hypothesis_content.title: Regime Transition Momentum Fade on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC attempts a regime transition from NEUTRAL to BULL (price > 1.5*30D ATR above 30D MA) but fails to sustain momentum (RSI(14) > 70 then drops below 60 within 3 days), a mean reversion back into NEUTRAL regime occurs with 85% probability within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts from NEUTRAL regimes often trap late momentum buyers, creating selling pressure as weak hands exit. The combination of overbought RSI with failed follow-through indicates lack of institutional conviction for sustained bull move.
entry_conditions: RSI(14) drops below 60 within 3 days of breakout
Price remains within 0.8*ATR of breakout level

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.5*ATR of 30D MA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains > 1.75*ATR above 30D MA for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals lead to successful BULL regime transition instead of mean reversion
